article:
Vagabond {{Comics character list header |name=Vagabond |Marvelwiki= |Marveldb=
|CBDBid= |GCDid= }} 'Priscilla Lyons' ('Vagabond') is a superhero in the Marvel
Comics universe. Created by Mark Gruenwald and Paul Neary, the character first
appeared in Captain America #325 in January 1987. Within the context of the
stories, Priscilla is an ally of Jack Monroe.

Vague {{Comics character list header |name=Vague |Marvelwiki= |Marveldb=
|CBDBid= |GCDid= }} 'Vague' is a mutant in the Marvel Comics universe. Created
by Peter David and Larry Stroman, the character first appeared in X-Factor #80.
Within the context of the stories, Vague could become transparent or invisible.
She lost her abilities due to events of M-Day.

Vakume

'Vakume' is a magical supervillain in the Marvel Comics universe. Created by Len
Wein and George PÃ©rez, the character first appeared in Fantastic Four #186 in
September 1977. Within the context of the stories, he is a member of Salem's
Seven and is able to control air.

Valinor {{Comics character list header |name=Valinor |Marvelwiki= |Marveldb=
|CBDBid= |GCDid= }} 'Valinor' is the Black Knight's steed in the Marvel Comics
universe. Created by Steven Parkhouse and John Stokes, the character first
appeared in [[Hulk (comics)|Hulk Comic]] #1 in March 1979. Within the context
of the stories, Valinor is a magically enhanced horse from the extra-
dimensional realm of Avalon. He serves as a steed of the Black Knight after he
had given his previous steed Aragorn to the Valkyrie, Avengers #226
and the Blood Wraith in battle against the Black Knight and the
Avengers. Avengers Annual #22

Valkin {{Comics character list header |name=Valkin |Marvelwiki= |Marveldb=
|CBDBid= |GCDid= }} 'Valkin' is an Eternal in the Marvel Comics universe.
Created by Jack Kirby, the character first appeared in The Eternals vol. 1 #11
in May 1977. Within the context of the stories, Valkin Valkin is the former
leader of the Polar Eternals and the uncle and adoptive father of Ikaris. Around
3000BC he led the Eternal settlement in the Southern Andean mountains to teach
and cultivate the ancestors of the Aztecs and Incas. In modern times, he went to
Olympia to participate in the formation of a Uni-Mind. Eternals Vol. 1
#11 With the other Eternals, he prepared for the coming of the Third
Celestial Host of Celestials in South America; his brother Virako died battling
the World-Worm, and Valkin adopted Virako's son Ikaris. as told in Thor
Annual #7 In modern times, he became the leader of a group of Eternals
that left Earth in the form of the Uni-Mind. Avengers #248

Valkyrie

'Valkyrie' is an Asgardian in the Marvel Comics universe. Created by Roy Thomas
and John Buscema, the character first appeared in Avengers #83 in December 1970.
Within the context of the stories, Valkyrie has been allied with other
Asgardians, the Valkyrior, Defenders, and Secret Avengers.

Valtorr

'Valtorr' is a demon in the Marvel Comics universe. The character first appeared
in X-Men #12 in 1965.

Vamp {{Comics character list header |name=Vamp |Marvelwiki= |Marveldb= |CBDBid=
|GCDid= }} 'Vamp' is a Corporation agent in the Marvel Comics universe. The
character, created by Roy Thomas, Don Glut, and John Buscema, first appeared in
Captain America #217 in January 1978. Within the context of the stories, Vamp
has an evil alter-ego called 'Animus' and infiltrates S.H.I.E.L.D. Captain
America #222-223 She is killed by the Scourge of the Underworld, Mark
Gruenwald (w), Paul Neary (p), Dennis Janke (i). "Overkill" Captain America 319
(July 1986), Marvel Comics but later appears in a prison
break. Deadpool vol 1 #0

Vampiro {{Comics character list header |name=Vampiro |Marvelwiki= |Marveldb=
|CBDBid= |GCDid= }} 'Vampiro' is the name of two characters in the Marvel Comics
universe. The first character, created by Roy Thomas and Arvell Jones, first
appeared in The Mighty Thor #290 in December 1979. Within the context of the
stories, Vampiro is an Eternal who is a professional wrestler.

The second character, created by Erik Larsen, Coy Turnbull and Al Milgrom, first
appeared in Nova vol. 3 #5 in September 1999. Within the context of the stories,
Vampiro is a villain who fights Nova and Spider-Man. Nova vol 3 #5
(September 1999) He is later killed by The Hood. Avengers: The
Initiative #31 (April 2010)

Rachel Van Helsing {{Comics character list header |name=Rachel van Helsing
|Marvelwiki= |Marveldb= |CBDBid= |GCDid= }} 'Rachel van Helsing' is a vampire
hunter in the Marvel Comics universe. The character, created by Archie Goodwin
and Gene Colan, first appeared in Tomb of Dracula #3 in July 1972. Within the
context of the stories, she is the great-granddaughter of Abraham Van Helsing.
She is killed by Dracula and turned into a vampire. She asks Wolverine to kill
her, and he does. Uncanny X-Men Annual #6 Frank Drake avenged her
death. Doctor Strange vol. 2 #61-62

Rachel van Helsing in other media
* In the English dub of the Toei animated Tomb of Dracula TV movie
  (Dracula: Sovereign of the Damned), Rachel Van Helsing was voiced by
  actress Melanie McQueen.

Katrina Van Horn

'Katrina van Horn' ('Man-Killer') is a supervillain in the Marvel Comics
universe. The character, created by Jim Mooney and Gerry Conway, first appeared
in [[Marvel Team-Up]] #8 in April 1973. Within the context of the stories, she
is a militant feminist who has worked for HYDRA and Advanced Idea Mechanics.

Michael Van Patrick

'Michael Van Patrick' is a hero in the Marvel Comics universe. The character,
created by Dan Slott and Stefano Caselli, first appeared in [[Avengers: The
Initiative]] #1 in March, 2007. Within the context of the stories, Van Patrick
is recruited to the Avengers as 'MVP' and accidentally killed during
training. Avengers: The Initiative #1 (March 2007) He is later
cloned. Avengers: The Initiative Annual #1

Vanguard {{Comics character list header |name=Vanguard |Marvelwiki= |Marveldb=
|CBDBid= |GCDid= }} 'Vanguard' ('Nikolai Krylenko') is a mutant in the Marvel
Comics universe. The character, created by Bill Mantlo and Carmine Infantino,
first appeared in Iron Man #109 in April 1978. Within the context of the
stories, Vanguard is Russian and the son of Sergei Krylov. He is trained as a
soldier and comes into conflict with Iron Man, Jack of Hearts, and other
Avengers. After dying and being resurrected by his father, Vanguard becomes the
new Red Guardian and leads the Winter Guard. Darkstar and the Winter Guard
#2-3

Vanisher

'Vanisher' ('Telford Porter') is a mutant supervillain in the Marvel Comics
universe. The character, created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, first appeared in
X-Men #2 in November, 1963. Within the context of the stories, Vanisher is an
enemy of the X-Men.

Vapor

'Vapor' ('Ann Darnell') is a member of the U-Foes in the Marvel Comics universe.
Created by Bill Mantlo and Sal Buscema, the character first appeared in
Incredible Hulk #254 in December 1980. Within the context of the stories, Vapor
and the U-Foes gain superpowers by duplicating the origin of the Fantastic Four,
and appear as enemies of the Hulk.

Vargas {{Comics character list header |name=Vargas |Marvelwiki= |Marveldb=
|CBDBid= |GCDid= }} 'Vargas' is a mutant supervillain in the Marvel Comics
universe. The character, created by Chris Claremont and Salvador Larroca, first
appeared in [[X-Treme X-Men]] #1 in 2001. Within the context of the stories,
Vargas comes into conflict with the X-Men while searching for the diaries of Destiny. X-
Treme X-Men #1 He is killed by Rogue. X-Treme X-Men #17

Varnae {{Comics character list header |name=Varnae |Marvelwiki= |Marveldb=
|CBDBid= |GCDid= }} 'Varnae' is a vampire in the Marvel Comics universe. The
character, created by Steve Perry and Steve Bissette, first appeared in
[[Bizarre Adventures]] #33 in December 1982. Within the context of the stories,
Varnae is the first vampire and is the one who created Dracula. At various times
in his life, he is an enemy of King Kull, Frank Drake, and John Blaze. He
eventually tired of his eternal life and committed suicide by walking into
sunlight and disintegrating, but he was resurrected years later by the voodoo
priestess, Marie LaVeau but was confronted by Doctor Strange. The Sorcerer
Supreme and the Lord of the Vampires battled, Varnae changing shape and
revealing he had formerly sought to be Sorcerer Supreme before he became a
vampire. Strange cast an "incantation of oblivion" on Varnae, making the undead
mage relive his oblivion of five centuries. Embracing his existence as a vampire
again, Varnae fled, claiming with Strange he finally had a reason to live again:
A worthy foe.

Wendell Vaughn

'Wendell Vaughn' ('Quasar') is a superhero in the Marvel Comics universe.
Created by Donald F. Glut, Roy Thomas and John Buscema, the character first
appeared under the alias 'Marvel Man' in [[Captain America]] #217 (January 1978)
and assumed the alias Quasar in [[The Incredible Hulk]] #234 (April 1979).
Quasar's superpowers include flight, teleportation, and energy manipulation, and
derive from the pair of Quantum Bands he wears on his wrists.

Vavavoom {{Comics character list header |name=Vavavoom |Marvelwiki= |Marveldb=
|CBDBid= |GCDid= }} 'Vavavoom' ('Dawn Middlebury') is a superhuman in the Marvel
Comics universe. Created by Michael Carlin and Ron Wilson, the character first
appeared in The Thing #33 in March 1986. Within the context of the stories,
Vavavoom received her powers from the Power Broker. She is a member of the
Unlimited Class Wrestling Federation.

Vector

'Vector' ('Simon Utrecht') is a member of the U-Foes in the Marvel Comics
universe. Created by Bill Mantlo and Sal Buscema, the character first appeared
in Incredible Hulk #254 in December 1980. Within the context of the stories,
Vector and the U-Foes gain superpowers by duplicating the origin of the
Fantastic Four, and appear as enemies of the Hulk.

Veda

'Veda' ('Magdalena "Maggie" Marie Neuntauben') is a member of The Order in the
Marvel Comics universe. Created by Matt Fraction and Barry Kitson, the character
first appeared in The Order vol 2 #1 in November 2007. Within the context of the
stories, Veda can summon soldiers from organic material.

Vegas {{Comics character list header |name=Vegas |Marvelwiki= |Marveldb=
|CBDBid= |GCDid= }} Vegas is a superhero in the Marvel Comics universe. The
character, created by Karl Kesel and Carmine Di Giandomenico, first appeared in
[[Amazing Fantasy]] vol. 2 #13 (2003). Within the context of the story, Vegas is
an anomalito, a person with superhuman abilities, described in Amazing Fantasy
as "super-types without super-tights." Vegas temporarily joins the evil
Renegades to be with his romantic interest Rose Red, but later opposes them.
Vegas later accepts a position as a bounty-hunter, under the patronage of Texas
Ranger Sgt. Harlan Stone.

Veil {{Comics character list header |name=Veil |Marvelwiki= |Marveldb= |CBDBid=
|GCDid= }} 'Veil' is a codename used by three people in the Marvel Comics
universe. The first character, created by Fabian Nicieza and Kirk Jarvinen,
appeared as part of the Desert Sword team in New Mutants Annual #7 in 1991. The
second, created by Jimmy Palmiotti and Justin Gray, appeared in [[Heroes for
Hire]] vol 2 in 2006 as an anti-regulaton protestor during the Superhuman Civil
War. The third, 'Madeline Berry', was created by Christos Gage and Mike McKone.
She appeared in [[Avengers Academy]] #1 in 2010. Her powers were killing her
until she was able to find a cure that saved her life but rendered her
powerless. At the series' conclusion, Veil was sent back home to high school to
live as a normal student, avoiding the events of [[Avengers Arena]].

Velocidad {{Comics character list header |name=Gabriel Cohuelo |Marvelwiki=
|Marveldb= |CBDBid= |GCDid= }} 'Velocidad' ('Gabriel Cohuelo') is a mutant in
the Marvel Comics universe. The first character, created by Matt Fraction and
Kieron Gillen, first appeared in Uncanny X-Men #527 in 2010.

Within the context of the stories, Gabriel is a 16-year-old mutant from Mexico
City. He is unable to control his mutant powers until assisted by Hope
Summers. Uncanny X-Men #527 (2010) Gabriel follows Hope on
her mission to find other young mutants, and they ally with Oya and Primal. He
and his friends relocate to Utopia, Generation Hope #4
(2011) where they are trained by more experienced X-Men. Generation Hope #5 (2011) Gabriel and Hope begin a romantic
relationship, Generation Hope vol. 1 #10 but it ends when Hope
discovers him kissing Pixie. Because Velocidad's powers work by accelerating him
through time, the use of his powers causes rapid aging. Generation Hope #15 A four-hour mission can last several
days from his perspective, and he is capable of burning
through several days of his life in a matter of minutes. Generation Hope #16

Other versions of Velocidad *Gabriel appears briefly in the [[Age of X]]
storyline. Like his main-universe counterpart, this version of Gabriel has a
marked enthusiasm for the codename "Velocidad". Age of X: Universe #2
(2011)

Vengeance

'Vengeance' is an entity in the Marvel Comics universe. Created by Howard
Mackie, the character first appeared in Ghost Rider #21 in January 1992. Within
the context of the stories, Vengeance is a Spirit of Vengeance, an entity sent
from Heaven to punish sinners.

Venom

'Venom' is a symbiote in the Marvel Comics universe. Created by David
Michelinie, the character first appeared in The Amazing Spider-Man #252 in May
1982. Within the context of the stories, it grants superpowers to any host with
whom it bonds.

Venomm
* Venomm

Sharon Ventura

'Sharon Ventura' is a heroine in the Marvel Comics universe. Created by Mike
Carlin and Ron Wilson, the character first appeared in The Thing #27 in
September 1985. Within the context of the stories, she is an ally of the
Fantastic Four.

Venus

'Venus' is the name of two characters in the Marvel Comics universe. The first
originally appeared in Venus #1 in the 1940s. Within the context of the stories,
she is an Olympian who works with the Agents of Atlas.

The second, also known as 'Aphrodite', was created by Jeff Parker and Carlo
Pagulayan and debuted in X-Men vs. Agents of Atlas #2 in November 2009.
Within the context of the stories, she attacks the first Venus, whom she sees
as an imposter.

Venus Dee Milo {{Comics character list header |name=Venus Dee Milo |Marvelwiki=
|Marveldb= |CBDBid= |GCDid= }} 'Venus Dee Milo' is a mutant in the Marvel Comics
universe. Created by Peter Milligan and Mike Allred, the character first
appeared in [[X-Statix]] #1 in 2002. Within the context of the stories, Venus
Dee Milo is a member of the mutant group X-Statix.

Veranke

'Veranke' is a Skrull queen in the Marvel Comics universe. The character,
created by Brian Michael Bendis and Jim Cheung, first appeared in disguise in
New Avengers #1 in 2005. Her true identity was revealed in New Avengers #40.

Within the context of the stories, Veranke is the queen of the Skrulls and leads
the Secret Invasion of Earth.

Veritas {{Comics character list header |name=Veritas |Marvelwiki= |Marveldb=
|CBDBid= |GCDid= }} 'Veritas' is a being in the Marvel Comics universe. The
character, created by Stan Lee and Marie Severin, first appeared in [[Strange
Tales]] #154 in March 1967.

Within the context of the stories, Veritas is a mysterious being who embodies
truth, and has precognitive powers. Veritas helped Doctor Strange defeat
Umar, Strange Tales #154 (March 1967) and assisted Nova and the New
Warriors against the Sphinx while using the name "Sayge". Nova
#10 New Warriors #13 New Warriors #50

Vermin

'Vermin' is a supervillain in the Marvel Comics universe. Created by J. M.
DeMatteis and Mike Zeck, the character first appeared in Captain America #272
in August 1982. Within the context of the stories, Vermin is an enemy of
Captain America, Captain America #272 (August 1982) Spider-
Man, The Spectacular Spider-Man #132 and the Avengers. New
Avengers Annual #2

Kristoff Vernard

'Kristoff Vernard' is an enemy, ally, and temporary member of the Fantastic Four
in the Marvel Comics universe. The character, created by John Byrne, first
appeared in Fantastic Four #247 in October 1982. Within the context of the
stories, Vernard is an heir to Doctor Doom and a time traveler.

Vertigo

'Vertigo' is a native of the Savage Landin the Marvel Comics universe. The
character, created by Chris Claremont and Michael Golden, first appeared in
Marvel Fanfare vol. 1 #1 in March 1982. Within the context of the stories,
Vertigo obtained powers through genetic engineering, allowing her to render a
person severely dizzy and even unconscious.

Vertigo (Salem's Seven)


Vesper


Vessel


Vesta {{Comics character list header |name=Vesta |Marvelwiki= |Marveldb=Hestia
(Earth-616) |CBDBid= |GCDid= }} 'Vesta' or 'Hestia' is a fictional character in
the Marvel Comics universe. She first appeared in [[Thor (Marvel Comics)|Thor]]
#301 (November 1980), and was adapted from mythology by Mark Gruenwald, Ralph
Macchio, and Keith Pollard.

Vesta is the goddess of the hearth in the Olympian pantheon.

Zeus, Neptune, and Pluto are her brothers, and Hera and Demeter are her sisters.

Vesta was present when Thor came to Olympus to ask for help from Zeus in
reviving Asgardians who were slain in battle with the Celestials.

Vesta was present at the funeral of Hercules when Athena laid claim to the
throne of Olympus, and did not oppose Athena even though she was the sister of
Zeus, because she did not want to rule.

Vesta appeared as part of the "Olympian Gods" entry in the [[Official Handbook
of the Marvel Universe|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe Deluxe
Edition]] #9.

Vibrania


Vibranium {{Comics character list header |name=Vibranium |Marvelwiki= |Marveldb=
|CBDBid= |GCDid= }} 'Vibranium' ('Baru') is a superhero in the Marvel Comics
universe. The character, created by Pat Graphy, Mike Gustovich and Tom Palmer,
first appeared in Deathlok vol. 2 #23 in May 1993. Within the context of the
stories, Baru is the former king of Canaan, Deathlok vol. 2 #23 (May
1993) and is turned into living vibranium by Diablo. ''Avengers
Collector's Edition #1 (1993)

Vibraxas


Vibro


Clive Vickers


Victorius


Vidar


Vienna


Vincente


Vindaloo {{Comics character list header |name=Vindaloo |Marvelwiki=
|Marveldb= |CBDBid= |GCDid= }} 'Vindaloo' is a mutant in the Marvel Comics
universe. The character, created by Alan Davis and Fabian Nicieza, first
appeared in Uncanny X-Men #366. Within the context of the stories, Vindaloo
is a member of the Acolytes.

Vindicator


Viper


Viper (Madame Hydra)


Virako


Virgo


Vishanti


Visimajoris {{Comics character list header |name=Visimajoris|Marvelwiki=
|Marveldb= |CBDBid= |GCDid= }} 'Visimajoris' is a demon in the Marvel Comics
universe. The character, created by Jim Starlin and Al Milgrom, first appeared
in [[Doctor Strange]] #24 in August 1977. Within the context of the stories,
Visimajoris serves the Creators and is an enemy of Doctor Strange.

Vision (Timely Comics)


Vision (Marvel Comics)


Vivisector


Amelia Voght


Voice


Philip Nolan Voigt


Volcana


Volla


Volstagg


Lucia von Bardas


Baron Von Blitzschlag


Friedrich Von Roehm


Ludwig von Shtupf


Andrea von Strucker


Andreas von Strucker
